body: Happy to accept a PR excluding it! (And maybe other useless files for good measureâ€”except `src`, we want it there.)
Also, hey, thanks for the heads up.
OK - I wanted to make sure that excluding .babelrc was OK and you weren't shipping it next to src for some reason.
I think you could make the argument that Babel shouldn't be processing .babelrc files under node_modules... imagine `npm linked` copies of Redux for example.
Usually people turn that off with Webpack/Browserify, but React Native Packager doesn't seem to offer/favor ignoring third-party modules?

RN is in a unique situation where the JS files under node_modules are ES7, so we want Babel to transform them. But we want Babel to use only the config options that are specified when calling `babel.transform(...)` plus the options in the root project's .babelrc file. So instead of `--ignore node_modules` we want (hypothetically) `--ignore-babelrc node_modules`.

AFAIK JSPM doesn't care about `.babelrc` at all but IIRC @guybedford was considering it or had it planned?  I don't remember exactly.  I've personally always kinda avoided using a `.babelrc` and most other dotfiles unless necessary.  Come to think of it I'll make a note to update my fork of `library-boilerplate` and remove `.babelrc` from it.

issue.title: Use files in package.json

repository.name: redux
repository.description: A JS library for predictable global state management

issue.body:
Fixes #1033

Before:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1404810/11168841/c6b101fe-8ba1-11e5-82b8-6cacc20e9af9.png)

After:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1404810/11168842/d03b150c-8ba1-11e5-9199-30663c67e1ff.png)

Difference is .editorconfig, .babelrc, CNAME, CODE_OF_CONDUCT and PATRONS. Can add back if you want. I'm also guessing `dist` is supposed to be included for npmcdn etc.

A whitelist is much easier to manage than a blacklist, as can be seen in the diff of this PR

issue.title: Support Babel 6

repository.name: react-native-button
repository.description: A React Native button component customizable via props

issue.body: React Native 0.16.0-rc uses Babel 6 so this would be nice. I'm not sure how much work that is to do.

issue.title: Add .babelrc to .npmignore
issue.body: As discussed [here](https://github.com/rackt/redux/issues/1033#issue-116870190), [and more here](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/4062), excluding `.babelrc` when distributing to npm is the current solution to #43.

issue.title: Extract babel config from package.json to .babelrc to enable React Native support

repository.name: proptypes-schema
repository.description: Generic object schema validation modeled on React PropTypes

issue.body:
Hi Eliot, I love `proptypes-schema` - I think it's a fantastic library.

We're using it with React Native and ran into a problem, so we thought we'd send you a pull request for the solution we came up with.

While using `proptypes-schema` with React Native, we found that React Native's packager gets a bit confused with `babel-preset-stage-0`. More details are here: https://github.com/reactjs/redux/issues/1033

The solution we came up with was to pull out the babel config into a separate `.babelrc` and add it to `.npmignore`.

issue.title: chore(META): exclude .babelrc from NPM builds

repository.name: cyclejs
repository.description: A functional and reactive JavaScript framework for predictable code

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for your contribution!
To help speed up the process of merging your code, check the following:
-->

- [ ] I added new tests for the issue I fixed/built (n/a)
- [ ] I ran `npm test` for the package I'm modifying (n/a)
- [x] I used `npm run commit` instead of `git commit`

It's not needed anyway. It's also causing issues when used with React-Native packager, which processes node_modules with Babel

(https://github.com/reactjs/redux/issues/1033#issuecomment-156584084)
